transcript.text: And good evening my friends, and welcome to Abitibi !
A region located 4 hours away from Outawei,
where we went rafting last time.
We arrived here, like, 2 hours ago, we had enough time  to eat and have some coffee
to change our clothes, and we are in shorts !
This afternoon’s program is biking in the mountains of Abitibi.
With the rafting and all the activities we did last days, I'm getting a little tired.
but I'm going to give all for the bicycle, because it’s the last tiring activity.
Anyway, I've fixed a bunch of GoPros everywhere like at the rafting
and see you in a minute on my bike !
Ok guys, after this little beer, we got time to wash up
it's been 48 hours, one of the best moments of my life
we checked ourselves, to see if we had ticks, cause we didn't have the time previously
We're a little tired, but it's ok cause we're gonna chill here
I'm gonna explain to you what is "Le Val d'Or", it's the town where we are
it's a town located in Abitibi
which essentially depends on mining exploitation
there are mines that essentially exploits gold
and behind me, there's a typical house built in the 1920's
for the miners, people who went to mine gold, they were entitled to have a house like this
only if they were in a relationship.
Which means being handsome was a big advantage at the time
Because we should be aware that there are still families that live in these houses
and above all, there are still many people living here that work at the mines of the city
For example, the 3 people that we biked with earlier, all 3 work at the mine
Not in the same one, there are many as I said
but the 3 work at the mines, they have different jobs
And it's crazy, even today, it's been almost 100 years that they depend on mines exploitation
Us, we sleep in an inn next door, that doesn't look like this, but is lovely
and tommorrow, we'll be lucky enough to go and visit one of these mines
there will be no miners with us, it is desaffected
And, yeah, we can't wait !
Guys, it's time, after this beer and this good meal. We're going to the Val d'Or's carnival.
Here we go, I'm gonna do my showman voice for all the rest of the video, amazing !
I have a problem, Passe Partout wants to take me to the next challenge, but I'm not in Fort Boyard !
Guys, we're in the the great wheel of the Val d'Or's carnival !
With these people who have been following me
Girl: It's badly attached sometimes, when you go up (???)
Listen, it was very enriching to meet all of you tonight
I didn't think I would get recognized this much at the carnival
You were all great, you even offered me stuff, it was very touching !
A thousand thank you ! We're ready to visit the mines tommorrow
And we're going to sleep on the beautiful notes

See you tommorrow! Can you say "See you tommorrow ?
- "See you Tommorrow!"
Hello, friends. Did you sleep well ? We did !
It's 9 A.M, we're here with Guy-Édoire.
Guy-Édoire: Hello, nice to meet you !
We are on the site of "The City of Gold". Do we start right now ?
Guy: We do !
I think we need to change our clothes, because it will be 46°F underground..
Guy: Some warm clothes, a helmet, a belt...
Guy: And then will we go underground.
Wonderful ! We will look like Indiana Jones ! Let's go !
Guys we're in the changing room, we'll put on clothes like these ones.
the drilling of the galleries !
This is how they collected the rock, with some drills,
that weighted about 165 pounds !
165 pounds !
And sometimes they climbed ladders with this on the back. They were so strong !
And maybe we could show the lunch room ?
Super spacious, 5 stars.
That's it ! We visited the entier thing !
Microwave of the time ! Of course...
This place was also a safe place, if there's fire,
a lot of smoke... They take refuge here, and there is a phone,
to contact the surface. And that is dangerous,
in a mine they always work in pairs,
because there's is a loooot of noise, so that if you got a problem,
if you're injured or whatever, you can't scream for help, nobody will hear you.
But when a morning, one of them two is all hung over
and decide to sleep one hour, his coworker is alone !
And this is dangerous. Morality: do not drink alcohol before work !
Um, well, do not drink alcohol AT ALL !
We're now in front of a trolley used at time by minors.
In the 30's they pushed it with their arms,
then they discharged with a handle.
It was such a manual work ! 5 or 10 years later,
it has already evolved ! Look, there was a huge motor.
At time, it was right in the middle of the corridors.
And here there's an electric motor !
And you can charge your iPhone right here...
It transported about 4 trolleys
like this one, full of rocks.
To give you an idea, in this mine,
according to the gold concentration,
this mine was really rich in gold. 5 tons of rocks were needed to get 1 ounce of gold.
In some other mines you would need 10 tons, 20, 30 sometimes...
So this mine was reallyyy efficient.
Now imagine THIS sound, 40 times more...
Are we done ?
Argh ! Guys, I hate loud sounds,
I could never work as a minor !
imagine this 40 times more !
And you add drills, machines...
We are one day in a mine, and we feel like..dying !
They did this for years !
So that, huge respect to all the minors !
Guys welcome in KINAWIT,
This is where our trip to Canada will end. Are you sad Clément? (guy behind the camera)
"Kinawit" means "all for all".
This is a community center,
that was created for the natives.
We saw some of them at the carnival last night !
In France there's just a few of Natives Americans... Which is logical, 'cause... [laughs]
We will sleep in the tepee right there
the traditional housing. This is also a typical Native American car...
You can feel that we're tired, see the bullshit I say !
Guys, it will be resting, in the nature...
We will sleep in a tepee
for the second time ! Perfect to end our trip. It will be nice !
Let's go Clément
The tiredness is there, we really want to sleep right now.

We lived a lot of positive things, we met people, we discovered regions
we've seen the town we've seen the campaign we've done some extrem sports we've meet Nabil, Frederic
